body: How does the CSRF commit by gaker close this issue? Does current_url() still always return "http://..." ?
@aphofstede Most likely a mistake as I don't see anything related to this issue in the referenced commit - thanks for noting it.

No problem.
Note: We worked around it by setting "base_url" in the config to https://... and referencing that one for our own url mangling.

I guess the question really is - do we want the protocol detection or not.

I'd say yes. @philsturgeon @alexbilbie ?

If you use https to load the page, the links will be built with https. If you link to assets with a relative path they will be https, and if your asset lib uses the base_url then you will still be using https.

Whats the problem here?

Forcing SSL should be done on a server  config level not PHP.

I think it should use protocol-relative urls. Eg //website.domain/path

That way, it just works either way.

@philsturgeon There is indeed HTTPS detection in `CI_Config::__construct()`, but it only runs if `$config['base_url']` is empty. But if I set it as _http://mydomain.tld/_ or _https://mydomain.tld/_ - this will always be what `base_url()` returns, regardless of the protocol that I've used to access the page.
The latter would work as forced SSL via config (as you've said it should be done) and it's why I wondered if we would want this new functionality. What would be new is that `base_url()` would always detect which one is used currently, so that it never returns _https_ when we're not using encryption and vice-versa.
@timw4mail That might not be handled properly by all browsers.
@narfbg I'm pretty sure it is. I'm pretty sure it's older than Netscape.

No need, pyro (and of course codeigniter) just uses whatever you are using. No need to get fancy about it.
